Hi,
I was wondering if anyone could help me out setting up junit to test
EJBs. I downloaded a copy of junit from an article on www.javaworld.com
by Michael Nygard and Traci Karsjens entitled "Test infect your
Enterprise Java Beans". I've tried going through the procedure for
getting the test example working, but to no avail - the code compiles,
packages and deploys fine, but when I enter the test suite class file
name in the first servlet form and then hit enter, I get an internal
server error, with a
NoClassDefFoundError being thrown for class junit.framework.TestCase.
Following the stack trace indicates that it gets thrown by the servlet
when it's trying to load the test suite class: -

package junit.servletui;
...
public class TestRunner extends HttpServlet {
...
  protected Test createTestSuite(...) {
    ...
    try {
      testClass = Class.forName(classUnderTest); // Error here.
    }...}...}

Class.forName can find classUnderTest, but not TestCase, which it
extends.

The web application all seems to be packaged fine -
junit.framework.TestCase is present in the .WAR file in WEB-INF/classes,
the servlet engine just doesn't seem to be able to see it. 

I realise that this is possibly more of a question about web application
deployment than junit itself, but any pointers would be appreciated.

Jim Downing
